title: Riverheads volleyball sweeps Wilson
text:
Eden Otero , eotero@newsleader.com 9:15 p.m. EDT October 22, 2015 Buy Photo Riverheads' Blake Bartley lines up a serve during their volleyball game against Wilson Memorial on Thursday, Oct. 22, 2015. (Photo: Griffin Moores/The News Leader) Buy Photo 8 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
GREENVILLE - Every year there is a volleyball team that is stacked on all fronts. 
This year, that team is Riverheads. 
With a middle that not only has height, but also strength, an outside and right side that make even the hardest angled kills look simple, and a back line that commands the dig count, the Gladiators are the team to beat this season. 
The most obvious point to Riverheads' dominance is its ability to rally, which falls heavily on the defensive specialists and libero. 
In Riverheads' 3-0 win over Wilson Memorial, it was the rally that became most pivotal in deciding points, as they won by scores of 25-9, 27-25 and 25-14. 
Already up 2-0, Wilson had multiple opportunities to win rallies that were so long you could hear the crowd sigh with relief when they ended. 
But it was a game of momentum, and Wilson just never felt it. 
“The whole sport is just so about riding the wave sometimes,” Riverheads coach Ruth Thompson said. “When you can get on a wave and ride it, whether you’re working off the crowd or your own momentum, it goes far.” 
While Wilson struggled as a team, Abby Taylor managed to come out with two service points, 11 kills and 13 digs. Taylor led the Hornets in kills, and tied Hannah Johnson for most digs. 
On the other side of the court, Cassidey Chrisman and Emma Casto had 10 kills apiece, while Kelly Coffey had 11. 
But the most impressive performance came from Alice Wardy and libero Madison Cash, who may not have stood out in stats, but made a showing of their usefulness on the back line. 
“Our defense is all over the place,” Thompson said. “Volleyball is about momentum, and its huge momentum when you think a ball is about to drop and someone saves it or someone’s there to save something you thought was unsaveable.” 
With the postseason just a little over a week away, Thompson joked that Riverheads has one very specific focus: 
"Hitting the ball hard all the time. All the time."
